page.title: 15HOBBERGATE
page.content: This area is mainly intensively managed grassland. It is mainly dairy farming with a few sheep. A main road dissects this section, also a very minor road which at one time was the original carriageway to Stone and Leek. The hedgerows are thick with saplings of oak and beech and many others. There are several pools around which are used by Angling Clubs one of which was the British Legion Fenton Angling Club At the northern part of the section a short bridle path crossed the main road and joins the two Hamlets of Hobbergate and Knenhall. Including the farms there are only about ten dwellings in this area. There are no shops, but there is a Bus service which runs for twelve routes daily at intervals of thirty minutes.
